Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2018 09:24AM nocyart wrote: Glad you are feeling more like yourself. I have my exchange surgery on 1/7. I'm looking forward to getting the tissue expanders out. I had my mastectomy pre-chemo. I can't wait to start feeling more like myself again.
Posts.Title: CMF treatment survivors and experiences 19501952 2002chickadee

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2018 11:16AM nocyart wrote: I will be doing round 1 of 8 biweekly CMF treatments on Friday. I will have the neulasta pod that will release on Saturday. I'm planning to continue to work full time at a job that is physically demanding. I do have intermittent leave in place in case I need it. My oncologist seems to think that I'm going to breeze through chemo and I'm really hoping he is correct. I've started hydrating now. Will take loratadine starting Wednesday. I am 48 and postmenopausal. DCIS and IDC in left breast. I had a bilateral mastectomy on 5/25. I am stage 1a. No node involvement. Oncotype score of 27. Decision to do chemo was left up to me. I would never forgive myself if I didn't do chemo and the cancer came back so here we go.
Posts.Title: CMF treatment survivors and experiences 19501952 2002chickadee

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2018 06:29PM nocyart wrote: Decided to take the miralax since things slowed down a little bit. Just hope it doesn't push things in the other direction. Neulasta is clicking as I type. Hoping for no bone pain again. Went to a picnic for a few hours today. Invited to another tomorrow so hoping to feel up to going to that. Did you watch some football?

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2018 07:45PM nocyart wrote: I was given dexamethasone and zofran at time of infusion. I was sent home with both as well. I took the zofran as prescribed to prevent nausea but wondered if it was responsible for the headache so stopped. Next time I will only take it if I feel nauseous. Did not take the dexamethasone at all. Will talk to my oncologist before my next round. Might add some powerade into my regimen next time. Maybe I drank too much water.
